channel.title: The march of medicine
channel.description:
Drama series highlighting important moments in medicine. Each program also includes a public service announcement related to medicine or hospitals.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Louis Pasteur: The soft hearted man
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Louis Pasteur. It also includes a public service announcement by Eve Arden.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: Greene Vardiman Black: The father of modern dentistry
item.description: This program focuses on the story of dental pioneer Greene Vardiman Black. It also includes a public service announcement by actor Tab Hunter.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Wilhelm Roentgen: The magic rays
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Wilhelm Roentgen. It also includes a public service announcement by Robert Q. Lewis.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology
